name: Breadth-First Search
description: Finds shortest path (fewest hops) in unweighted graphs by exploring level by level
when_to_use: Unweighted graphs where you need the shortest path by number of edges
Finding nearest resource/node in a network
Level-order traversal of trees or graphs
Maze solving on grids with uniform step cost
when_not_to_use: Weighted graphs where edge costs vary (use UCS or A* instead)
Very deep graphs with solutions far from root (memory-intensive)
When any path suffices and memory is limited (use DFS instead)

complexity.time: O(V + E) where V = vertices, E = edges
complexity.space: O(V) â€” stores all vertices at current frontier

parameters.name: goal_test
parameters.description: Returns true if state is the goal

parameters.name: neighbors
parameters.description: Returns adjacent states for a given state

embedding_text: BFS breadth-first search finds the shortest path by number of hops in unweighted graphs. Explores all neighbors at current depth before moving deeper. Guarantees shortest path in unweighted graphs. Use when edges have equal cost and you need minimum hops.
